data.title: Laurence Olivier: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Laurence Olivier: Check out the list of all Laurence Olivier movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Laurence Olivier news on Times of India.
data.text:
Ian McKellen hospitalized after falling off stage in London; actor to make full recovery

AP / Jun 18, 2024, 05:22 (IST)

Actor Ian McKellen, known for playing Gandalf in 'Lord of the Rings,' was hospitalized after falling off a London stage during a scene in 'Player Kings' where he portrayed John Falstaff. The 85-year-old actor is expected to make a full recovery. Known for his roles in 'Lord of the Rings' and Shakespearean characters, McKellen's career spans six decades.

Harry Potter's Dumbledore and The Singing Detective actor Sir Michael Gambon dies at 82

etimes.in / Sep 28, 2023, 17:49 (IST)

Sir Michael Gambon, best known for his role as Albus Dumbledore in the Harry Potter films, has passed away at the age of 82. He rose to prominence in films such as Sleepy Hollow and Gosford Park, and had success on television with shows like The Singing Detective and Maigret. Gambon's career also included notable performances in Harold Pinter's plays. He will be remembered for his talent and distinctive voice.

Jane Austen scores a double ton

TNN / Jan 28, 2012, 05:17 (IST)

The 200th year of the publication of Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice starts today. A book that's vibrantly alive on screen, on tube and bookshelves was published on Jan 28, 1813. That year also saw the publication of Byron's The Giaour and Shelley's Queen Mab. Arthur Schopenhauer published On the Fourfold Root of the Principle of Sufficient Reason.

Out of court by Soli J Sorabjee: The Hague, Bihar & Laurence Olivier

TNN / Nov 26, 2272, 07:15 (IST)

Thirteen is the largest number of judges before whom I have argued in the Supreme Court in the historical Keshavanand Bharti case. At the International Court of Justice at the Hague, the judicial capital of the world housed in a grand building, I recently had to address sixteen silent judges in solemn attire. The judges represent principal legal systems of the world. In combining both oral and written phases of procedure, the Court blends the key features of the common and civil law systems. For me it was a unique experience. There were no questionings by the judges, no interruptions by opposing counsel, no humorous anecdotes and loud laughter. In short, no nonsense.

Out of court by Soli J Sorabjee: The Hague, Bihar & Laurence Olivier

TNN / Nov 25, 2272, 21:11 (IST)

Thirteen is the largest number of judges before whom I have argued in the Supreme Court in the historical Keshavanand Bharti case. At the International Court of Justice at the Hague, the judicial capital of the world housed in a grand building, I recently had to address sixteen silent judges in solemn attire. The judges represent principal legal systems of the world. In combining both oral and written phases of procedure, the Court blends the key features of the common and civil law systems. For me it was a unique experience. There were no questionings by the judges, no interruptions by opposing counsel, no humorous anecdotes and loud laughter. In short, no nonsense.

"We are very honoured to be included": Bradley Cooper on multiple Oscar nods for his directorial 'Maestro'

ANI / Jan 25, 2024, 14:10 (IST)

Bradley Cooper spoke candidly about the seven Oscar nominations received by 'Maestro' during an event in Los Angeles. The film, which garnered nods in categories like 'Best Picture', 'Best Actor', and 'Best Original Screenplay', elicited gratitude from Cooper, who expressed appreciation for being recognized alongside other exceptional works of art. Cooper also thanked Jamie, Alex, and Nina Bernstein for allowing their parents' stories to reach a wider audience and conveyed his honor at being acknowledged by the Academy. Cooper, known for his versatility as both an actor and director, joins a select group of actor-directors to earn multiple 'Best Actor' nominations at the Oscars. His previous directorial venture, 'A Star Is Born' (2018), starring Lady Gaga, marked his Hollywood directorial debut. Reflecting on his BAFTA nominations, which included a nod for 'Best Director', Cooper expressed excitement and gratitude, emphasizing his appreciation for the recognition from the esteemed British film awards. Despite not receiving a 'Best Director' nomination at the Oscars this year, Cooper remained upbeat, emphasizing his excitement at the film's overall success and the opportunity to celebrate with fellow industry professionals.
